attributes.action: Reform the UK Driving Test Booking System
attributes.additional_details:
Increase driving test availability and examiner capacity.

Introduce measures to prevent bots and automated rescheduling tools from abusing the system.

Improve transparency and fairness in the booking process.

This is a national issue that affects young people, low-income families, and essential workers. Urgent reform is needed to restore access and trust in a service many rely on.
attributes.background: Learner drivers are struggling to book practical driving tests. Slots are often unavailable for months. Bots and third-party apps are abusing the system, making access unfair.

rejection.details:
The Government has consulted on reforms to the UK driving test system:

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/transport-secretary-acts-to-make-thousands-of-extra-driving-tests-available-each-month

And the DVSA has set out how it plans to reduce driving test wait time:

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/dvsa-sets-out-plan-to-reduce-driving-test-waiting-times
